dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath) When I turn twenty-one, I don't want  any more of this life. My mother and  father will be surprised at the  incredible change. It will impress  them more when such a fuck up like  me turns good than if I had been a  good son all along. All the past  years I will think of as one big  vacation. At least it wasn't as  boring as schoolwork. All my bad  behavior I'm going to throw away to  pay my debt. I will change when  everybody expects it the least. Scott turns and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you will become a hard roller,  a hatchet man for your old man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott laughs to himself, because he knows Bob is misunder him. Bob is part of the past life that he says he is goin throw away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! You will be the hatchet man,  Bob, that will be your job, and so  there will rarely be a job  hatcheted. It will be one big  endless party, won't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob laughs. Scott walks across a field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, at least my little friend  has offered me a job. They are so  good to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Denise and Mike hang out together. Both are smoking cigar which have made a billow of smoke that hangs over the tab is in the front window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moms are great, because, you know,  I could always go to my mom and  say, hey I need a new lipstick,  and she would always give me money  for that. That was great. MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I only saw my mom once, but I  remember what she looked like. She  was very beautiful. DENISE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could you remember when that  god-awful thing happened? MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunno. But I remember it. how  beautiful and kind she good. Yeah,  I remember was. She was good DENISE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she split from you, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see what was going on,  Mike? Between Pinky and Dale? Did  you see that? That's the third  fight I've seen today. Things  always happen in threes. MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. They have a sort of,  ah, relationship. Between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the street there are three people, a TALL MAN, who hat stuck on his boot and a lady and another man with a d leash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know about that, but, ah,  listen, what you and me talk  about, it's just between us, you  understand? Hey, what's over  there, see those assholes? Who are  they, you know any of them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group across the street look up and begin yelling bac we cannot hear them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Denise kiss, and their arms are entangled in a l but awkward embrace. Twigs and leaves are caught in Denis as they are lying on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Different STILL COMPOSITIONS OF SEX while they are lying wilds under the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That reminds me, I gotta send my  Ma a Christmas card, I still  haven't done it yet. MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I haven't done it either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mom lives in Idaho right now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to live in Montana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My own cousin. He's dead. that's  one...two... And my grandma, it  usually comes in threes. DENISE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My cousin died, my grandmother  died, and right after she died,  her daughter died. My aunt. Within  a year. And they wuz all women,  not even a year, six...well....  six months-eight months, three  women in the family died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's funny, huh? I WONDER WHY  YOU THOUGHT THAT, cuz, my FATHER  says stuff like that. DENISE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father told me that, said  things usually come in threes...  and I said, .... you're crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Long pause. A motorcycle passes, someone yells, and a h honks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sounds crazy. That's my lucky  number too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know why I like eight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cause of the eight ball. You know.  When you're stuck behind the eight  ball? I fuckin' feel stuck behind  the eight ball today, I'll tell  you. The business is so slow in the  middle of the week, you know that  Mike?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike empties the contents of his pockets at a bathroom si has in his possession: One condom. One comb with blond ha in it. One nickel. Half a stick of gum. One knife with th W stamped on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He arranges these things in a neat order on the surface o sink while a man flushes a toilet in the background and u another sink. Mike is quite at home here. He takes his ti arranging the articles, and washing his hands. He looks o the man washing his hands and gives him a friendly smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man leaves. Mike puts all the things on the sink into pockets. Then he walks over to a urinal, unzips his fly a starts to take a leak. A shadow opens the door in back of and without turning around, Mike senses the presence of a Alleyway. Night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scottie is helping Bob with a disguise, putting on pants large belly, with medallions around the neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long has it been, Bob, since  you could see your own feet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About four years, Scottie. Four  years of grief. It blows a man up  like a balloon. Mike and Budd appear, running, with costumes on. There ar others behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's rock and roll money  walking this way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they're drunk as skunks. MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is going to be easy. We can  do it lying down. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But don't fall asleep, now, Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You four should head them off  there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We four? How many are walking with  them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh, shouldn't they be robbing us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scottie laughs. Bob waddles along the side of the alleywa stepping on a curb, then in a pothole losing his balance. accomplice whistles from atop a building. We SEE the grou ROCK AND ROLL promoters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob walks further from Mike and Scottie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If they escape from you, we'll get  them here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight feet of cobblestones is like  30 yards of flat road with me. Mike and Scott run off, laughing at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't see a damned thing in  here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, will you shut up! And keep  on your toes! Budd sees the promoters coming and waves to Bob as he lie on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lie down and stay quiet, until  they round the corner and we'll  ambush them. BOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you got a crane to lift me up  again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down the way, the rock and roll promoters are approaching no knowledge of the buffoonery at the other end of the tu alleyway. They are drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come along neighbor, Tommy will  lead the way. I've lost track of  time... (burp)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the other end of the alley:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob and three others are marching in procession, chanting facsimile of Rashneesh, but a bad act.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rock promoters approach, smashing a bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scottie and Mike hide behind garbage cans, laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rock promoters circle the group of chanting Rashneesh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought that all you Rashneesh  had up and left...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victim 1 pours a beer on one of their heads. Just as he d Bob pulls out two long pistols, almost heavy enough that cannot hold them straight, barrels parallel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aha! One move and I'll blow you  away, you sully scumbags, up  against that wall!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the victims falls down and begins to run away. One Bob's men starts after him. A lockbox that he was carryin to the ground. Bob spies it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob aims one pistol at the running figure as he keeps the against the wall with the other pistol. He fires three ti of Bob's boys grabs the lockbox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A VIEW of the running figure, bullets cutting around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob winks at the lockbox and shoots the gun in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the rock promoters go running. Bob charges after them the gun twice more in the air, then once at the lockbox, it open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The valise is open. Let's see what  we got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Scottie hiding behind trashcans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are our disguises? Mike runs to his stash and finds two large capes and larg They put these on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob finds wads of money and receipts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ticket anyone? To next week's  show?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws these on the ground and the boys fall over them for the tickets. Bob wads the money and puts it back in t laughing to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Scottie sneak closer to the group still hiding, flowing capes concealing their identity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott and Mike have disappeared,  did the shots scare them away?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sneak closer. Mike lights a big firecracker and wait

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...maybe we should get the hell  out of here. But, are they such  chickens?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Scottie, disguised, jump out with large silver b bats, swinging them and making as much noise as they can, knocking over a set of garbage cans, flashing flashlights Bob and the others' eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frightened, Bob drops the lockbox and runs, the others fo Mike and Scottie hitting them with the bats as they go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike swings the bat at Bob, it grazes the side of a build sparks fly from it. Bob wheezes from the run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scottie chases the others in the same direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stand, kicking garbage cans and watching them run,  convulsing with laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob Pigeon will sweat to death!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack Favor enters the Governor's CHAMBERS day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can anyone tell me about my son?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been a full three months  since I last saw him. Where is my  son Scott? AID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask around in Old Town, in some of  the taverns there. Some say he  frequently is seen down there  drinking with street denizens.  Some who they say even rob our  citizens and store owners. I can't  believe that such an effeminate  boy supports such 'friends.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A high overhead (helicopter?) view of the country landsca the early morning. Far below us on a lonely road is a sma a motorcycle, traveling east.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Further along on its travels, the motorcycle crosses a st BRIDGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old Town day. Scottie and Mike, riding on a stolen motorcycle, sweep th the early morning streets without being noticed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stopping at a stop light in the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mikey, do you realize how long I  have been here out on the streets,  on this crusade? MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About as long as the rest of us. I  mean. I can't even remember that  far back, Scott, I mean

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow... that's a really long time,  Scott. Have I been here three  years, too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I'm getting at, Mike, is that  we are survivors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, so, isn't that  obvious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. It is incredibly obvious.  They could drop a bomb on this  city and you know what we would  do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. We would survive. Because we  are...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, Scott. Whaddya say we go  survive over at the Broadway Cafe  a little bit, at least it's warm  over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Scott sit around the table with Carl and Mary. M blows a smoke ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Denise runs in the door of the cafe, excited about someth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIKE! Scottie! There's a man from  City Hall down the street. He  wants to speak with you, Scottie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says that he's sent by your  father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say hello and send him to my  mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of a man is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A young man. And he's got cops  with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two POLICEMEN and one OFFICIAL are walking down the stree the Broadway cafe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops enter, passing The PROPRIETOR of the cafe, an ag heavyset woman named NANCY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you this morning, NANCY?  Don't mind if we take a look  around your place, do you? One officer is already inspecting the stolen motorcycle o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike sees this, and looks the other way from the cop who peering in the Broadway cafe window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you seen the young Scott  Favor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do believe he was here just a  second ago. Nancy looks in the  front window. NANCY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott is giving Denise a long kiss, hiding from the cops. OFFICIAL walks to the front window of the Cafe.  Scott pr he is being rudely interrupted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me... Mr. Favor... we have  been sent in search of a fat  man... a large bearded.... COP 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahem. There's been a report, sir,  he has been involved in a  holdup...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last night. Have you seen him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw him around last night, when  was the holdup?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw him about four, but he  wasn't very loose with his wallet.  Did he get away with any of the  money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, indeed, sir... two thousand  dollars of a rock promoter's  money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, anyway, I haven't seen him  recently. Why do you look here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They say he has friends here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry for the interruption. We  have a message for you from your  father. He says that he would like  to see you as soon as possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott takes the envelope and puts it on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's not get Favor's kid involved  in this report if we can help it.  But if he were my son, I'd.... Cop 1 makes a fist and slams It In the palm of his other

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob is a wanted man now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as dangerous to be around as  cops themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike suddenly begins to shake, and, falls asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scottie picks up the envelope from his father and puts it pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Scott are stuck on a long straight road in the d Mike is angry at Scott because he doesn't think he knows motorcycle works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott is trying again and again to start the engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tries to turn it over again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I had known that it was going  to be this hard to start, then I  wouldn't have stopped it at all. Mike looks at the road and the surrounding area. It is th road that he was stuck on in the beginning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott? I just know that I have  been on this road before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike stares at the face in the road. Two cactus for eyes, mountains for hair, a cloud shadow forms the mouth over a nose road with a dotted line running down it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At night, Scott and Mike sit next to a fire they have mad side of the road.  We can hear Indians in the distance da and chanting a song.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sure is lonely out in the  desert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I had had a normal family, and  a good upbringing, then I would  have been a well adjusted person.  But somehow that just didn't work  out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, normal, you know, with a mom  and a dad and a dog and shit like  that... normal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you didn't have a dog?  Or you  didn't have a dad...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't have a dog and I didn't  have a dad. Well, not a normal  dad...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The music is getting louder. It sounds like a war chant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike is hesitating.  He is about to say something persona looks at Scott and back to the fire, a few times too many

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott is getting Mike's drift. Mike rubs his crotch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, don't you ever get horny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah... not for a guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike.  Two guys can't love each  other.  They can only be friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An awkward moment passes where Mike is looking away from and Scott can't help but look at Mike.  Then Scott catche eye and motions for him to come closer to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike walks over to Scott and Scott holds him in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Overhead VIEW of the two in front of the campfire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I only have sex for money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike starts to get out some money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we can be close friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The next morning. Mike is sleeping. As he opens his eyes, see Scott still trying to start the motorcycle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike stands and looks down the road at an approaching Sta Police Car. Mike, afraid of the police, starts to move in bushes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott is out of breath trying to start the bike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott looks in the direction of the police car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott hits the side of the gas tank of the bike with the his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't get the bike started. Cops  are coming. Stuck in the middle of  nowhere with a stolen bike. Yeah,  Mike. Looks like this is the end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The policeman pulls up to them and parks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The policeman sits in his car for a second and reports in radio, then he gets out and walks over to the boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike gets scared and runs into the desert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cop stands and watches. Mike has nowhere to go, he is into an open desert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The policeman, a full blooded American Indian, seems amus his power. He looks at Scott then back at Mike, who trips desert and falls in a cloud of dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I guess he doesn't  like cops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you kids doing out here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This cycle is one bitch to turn  over. But you probably don't know  about motorcycles. You aren't a  motorcycle cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott walks through the desert looking for Mike where he He picks him up out of the dirt, spit dripping from his s lips, and smacks him in the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake up, Mikey, the heat's off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Mike wakes up. He is inside a TRAILER at night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott is eating sandwiches to his right that are on a lit tray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is MIKE'S BROTHER leaning into him on his left. He Mike offensively. His brother is very good looking, but l like he has lost his mind somewhere down the line. Which he lives in the desert in a trailer, away from people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mother... now she was a right  woman. She used to be so proud of  you... you know... she would just  beam. And not Jim Beam either. If  you know what I mean. We used to  drive for hours to get a look at  you. I remember, what was it...  eighteen years ago? MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that how old you are now? I  thought you wuz younger than  that... what? Well anyway, we  would start off in the morning to  see you, and it would take an hour  to get to the institution. You  were maybe one year old. What?  I  wasn't proud that you had to live  in an institution, mind you... but  all the same, when I would look at  you, all the institutional walls  would come down and we were a  family. Your mom, me, and you. God  knows where dad was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike is getting visibly upset. Scott gets up to go to the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott enters and notices a velvet portrait of a woman han the wall. Off screen Scott can hear Mike and his Brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't belong to you, DUDE... I'm  not yours...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (his voice booms out so  unexpectedly deep and loud that  Scott is startled) Shut your  mouth! Don't you talk back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His brother hits the table with a crash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... (takes a breath ) Anyway. You were maybe not in the  biological sense, my brother, but in  our business, ~..... (holds his  hands up in the air) And If I'm not  Your brother, how's come you turned  out exactly like me then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike has gotten the jitters and fallen asleep in front of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, he'll come out or it. It's  like this whenever we get together   It's always like this when we get  together  It's the way that we say  hello to each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm all that he's got. But he  doesn't want me. He doesn't care.  He'd rather live out on the  streets. I love him, though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott looks around the trailer at all the velvet portrait hanging on the walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. I paint these for a living.  But sometimes the people don't  send the check when they get  finished. So I keep them. I like  them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and his brother sip iced tea. Colored lights decorat trailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want me to tell you what happened  to your Mom? Have you ever heard  it? Did you ever hear what the  hell happened to her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. But I don't care. BROTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You loved her, and don't tell know  you did. me you didn't. I

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I already heard what happened to  her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you don't know the whole  story. One thing about the truth.  It's interesting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you had known her, you would  care. She would see guys on the  side. At night. When I wouldn't be  around... maybe I'd be in San  Francisco or some darned place,  doing my own business. God knows  where. She would see guys...  yeah.... anyway   along comes this  guy. A guy we both knew. A guy who  was into cards. A gamblin' man.  And he said that he used to herd  cattle in Argentina. I dunno,  maybe he did, and he had a bit of  money. More'n I had at that point  in time. But it was funny, the way  he gambled. He was not safe in the  friends that he made. So his money  would come and go real fast.... MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never heard this one before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So this guy, your Mom fell for.  What? She went cuckoo over this  guy. Well, their affair went on  for a year or so and your mom  wanted to marry this guy. She was  already married to our real dad.  So he said no. He didn't love her  anyways. But she wanted him to  marry her. And to have a little  family. That's when you were born.  As a matter of fact, you were  really the cause of this whole  mess. She wanted to make a little  family and take you and this guy  someplace and set something up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A family thing! Ridiculous, right. A  card man. Had a bunch of money, but  could have just as well lost it on  his next hand. Probably did too. Well  you'll see what I'm getting at.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not how I heard it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know. You heard it from me  and I'm telling it different this  time, see? So this Mom of yours  found herself a fuckin' gun. I  thought she was going to blow me  away with it one night. She got so  into this gun. She would flash it  to anybody that gave her trouble.  She would sleep with it. Yeah...  strange, huh?
